title: Setting Up 750 Grain Drill for Kernza

tasks.task: Set up the 750 grain drill for drilling Kernza perennial wheatgrass.
subtasks: Adjust the drill's seed metering mechanism for accurate seeding rates.
Divide seed cups into groups for precise testing and adjustment.
Use adjustable half-speed gears to control the seed metering rate.
Monitor and adjust the number of active seed cups to achieve desired seeding density.
Verify seeding rate accuracy through manual calibration using a bagged sample.
Ensure proper engagement of the drill's planting mechanism by adjusting pressure valves.
Align clutch mechanisms for optimal transmission of power to the drill's seed cups.
Modify the drill for half-speed operation by creating a cutout for gear removal and replacement.
Utilize a stubby bottle jack to lift the drill for gear adjustments.

tasks.task: Prepare the drill for field operation by setting the planting speed and assessing real-time performance.
subtasks: Calibrate the drill's planting speed using GPS-triggered distance measurements.
Monitor real-time seeding rates during field operations using a loop monitor.
Adjust the drill's settings as necessary during field testing to achieve the desired seeding rate.
Verify final seeding rate accuracy through a second calibration check in the field.

tasks.task: Conduct final seed rate verification by comparing the adjusted rate to the planned rate.
subtasks: Convert the total weight of seed collected in bags to an estimate of the seeding rate per acre.
Compare the measured rate to the planned rate of 17 pounds per acre, making adjustments if necessary.
Account for variations in actual and planned seed rates to ensure proper coverage of the field.
